resources.string: Oops! There are no recipes to show
Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking
A cocktail is an alcoholic mixed drink, which is either a combination of spirits, or one or more spirits mixed with other ingredients such as fruit juice, flavored syrup, or cream
Usually consists of sweet foods, such as confections, and possibly a beverage such as dessert wine or liqueur
Egg yolks and whole eggs store significant amounts of protein and choline, and are widely used in cookery
Found in the fresh and salt waters of the world, fish has been an important source of protein and other nutrients for humans throughout history
Legumes are notable in that most of them have symbiotic nitrogen-fixing bacteria in structures called root nodules. For that reason, they play a key role in crop rotation
Meat is mainly composed of water, protein, and fat. It is edible raw, but is normally eaten after it has been cooked and seasoned or processed in a variety of ways
Edible mushrooms include many fungal species that are either harvested wild or cultivated
Italian type of food typically made from an unleavened dough of wheat flour mixed with water or eggs
Rice, a monocot, is normally grown as an annual plant, although in tropical areas it can survive as a perennial and can produce a ratoon crop for up to 30 years
Most sauces are not normally consumed by themselves; they add flavor, moisture, and visual appeal to a dish
Shellfish is a colloquial and fisheries term for exoskeleton-bearing aquatic invertebrates used as food, including various species of molluscs, crustaceans, and echinoderms
Traditionally, snacks are prepared from ingredients commonly available at home without a great deal of preparation
Soup is a primarily liquid food, generally served warm or hot (but may be cool or cold), that is made by combining ingredients of meat or vegetables with stock, or water
Originally, vegetables were collected from the wild by hunter-gatherers and entered cultivation in several parts of the world, probably during the period 10,000 BC to 7,000 BC
Enter a description of the recipe
ERROR: All fields should be filled. Password minimum length 4 characters
Congratulations, you are done! How does %s taste?
You have already rated this recipe
Thank you so much for installing AndroRecetas!
Are you sure to exit? The recipe will not be saved
Please enter any step before uploading the recipe
Please enter any ingredient before going to steps
Error: the field can not be empty
Here is the main menu. You need to create a profile in order to access to the content
Choose your profile. If there are still no profile created or you are a new user, use the button for creating one.
Please choose an avatar and a nickname for creating a new profile
Choose the new avatar or nickname (or both) and your profile will be edited at once
This is a quick view of the most relevant aspects of the recipe like the title, description, ratings…
A cuisine is a style of cooking characterized by distinctive ingredients, techniques and dishes, and usually associated with a specific culture or geographic region
A food group is a collection of foods that share similar nutritional properties or biological classifications
Enter the name of the recipe you wish to prepare and it will appear immediately
Here you can select the way you want to search your favourite recipe. Feel free to explore!
In this page you can watch the best-rated recipes, according to your votes. Only the top 5 recipes will appear here!
First you have to specify the name, description, group and cuisine. Then go to the next page for entering the ingredients
Add all steps of your recipe. When you are done, press the \'add recipe\' button and the recipe will be uploaded!
Add all ingredients of your recipe. Be careful and don\'t forget any of them!
Hi there, %s! Here is the tip of the day:
Please log in to get full access to the app
Please enter your password to log in
The app will not read each step of the recipe
Here you can setup then game options
ERROR: All fields should be filled.
Made by Miguel Ángel Ruz Franco
Here you can list all the ingredients for making your recipes. Click \"save\" for saving it or \"Clear\" for erasing.
Ingredients imported to shopping list successfully
